name: Addition and subtraction word problems within 100

skills.name: Add integers up to 2 digits using a written method where carrying is needed
Subtract integers up to 2 digits using a written method where carrying is needed

explanations.A: Not quite - I think you started counting up on 37 instead of 38. Count 38, 39, 40, ...
explanations.C: You have done 37 - 14, but "how many altogether?" tells us to add 37 + 14.
explanations.D: Almost! I think you forgot to carry the 10. 7 + 4 = 11, so we have an extra 10 to add up with the 30 and 10...

explanations.A: Almost! I think you forgot to carry the 10. 3 + 9 = 12, so we have an extra 10 to add up with the 20 and 40...
explanations.B: You have done 49 - 23, but "how many altogether?" tells us to add 23 + 49.
explanations.C: Not quite - I think you started counting up on 49 instead of 50. Count 50, 51, 52, ...

explanations.A: Jo gave away 27 so we do 43 - 27 = 16. We can split it up as 43 - 20 = 23, then 23 - 7 = 16.
explanations.B: You have added, but Jo gave away the 27 apples, so we do 43 - 27.
explanations.C: Not quite - I think you did 7 - 3 for the ones digit, but we need to subtract all of 27 from all of 43. Try counting back 20 and then 7.
explanations.D: Almost! I think you forgot to borrow 10. 3 is smaller than 7 so we borrow 10 and do 13 - 7 instead. How many tens are left to subtract 20 from?

explanations.A: Not quite - I think you did 6 - 4 for the ones digit, but we need to subtract all of 16 from all of 54. Try counting back 10 and then 6.
explanations.B: Juan gave away 16 so we do 54 - 16 = 38. We can split it up as 54 - 10 = 44, then 44 - 6 = 38.
explanations.C: Almost! I think you forgot to borrow 10. 4 is smaller than 6 so we borrow 10 and do 14 - 6 instead. How many tens are left to subtract 10 from?
explanations.D: You have added, but Juan gave away the 16 apples, so we do 54 - 16.

explanations.A: There are 22 people in front of Tom (numbers 1 - 22 in the line). How many are behind him, if there are 50 altogether?
explanations.B: Almost! I think you forgot to borrow 10. Try splitting this calculation up, and doing 50 - 20, then subtracting another 3.
explanations.C: There are 23 people up to and including Tom, so the rest of the line behind him is 50 - 23 = 27. We can split it as 50 - 20 = 30, then 30 - 3 = 27.
explanations.D: You have added 50 + 23, but we need to take everyone from the front to Tom (numbers 1-23) away from the line of 50 and see how many people are left.

explanations.A: There are 32 people up to and including Emory, so the rest of the line behind her is 50 - 32 = 18. We can split it as 50 - 30 = 20, then 20 - 2 = 18.
explanations.B: You have added 50 + 32, but we need to take everyone from the front to Emory (numbers 1-32) away from the line of 50 and see how many people are left.
explanations.C: There are 31 people in front of Emory (numbers 1 - 31 in the line). How many are behind her, if there are 50 altogether?
explanations.D: Almost! I think you forgot to borrow 10. Try splitting this calculation up, and doing 50 - 30, then subtracting another 2.

explanations.B: You have subtracted, but to find out how much money for both we need to add 25 + 49.
explanations.C: Almost! I think you forgot to carry the 10. 9 + 5 = 14, so we have an extra 10 to add up with the 20 and 40...
explanations.D: Not quite - I think you started counting up on 25 instead of 26. Count 26, 27, 28, ... Or add 40 and then 9.

explanations.A: You have subtracted, but to find out how much money for both we need to add 39 + 52.
explanations.B: Almost! I think you forgot to carry the 10. 9 + 2 = 11, so we have an extra 10 to add up with the 30 and 50...
explanations.C: Not quite - I think you started counting up on 39 instead of 40. Count 40, 41, 42, ... Or add 50 and then 2.

explanations.A: The eraser costs 15 cents less than 34 cents. 34 - 15 = 19 cents. Together they cost 34 + 19 = 53 cents.
explanations.B: Not quite - the question does not say an eraser costs 15 cents. If an eraser is 15 cents less than 34 cents, how much is it?
explanations.C: Almost! I think you forgot to carry the 10. The pencil and eraser cost 34 and 19 cents. 4 + 9 = 13, so we have an extra 10 to add up with the 30 and 10...
explanations.D: That's the correct price of the eraser, but how much do they cost together?

explanations.A: Not quite - the question does not say an eraser costs 19 cents. If an eraser is 19 cents less than 45 cents, how much is it?
explanations.B: That's the correct price of the eraser, but how much do they cost together?
explanations.C: The eraser costs 19 cents less than 45 cents. 45 - 19 = 26 cents. Together they cost 45 + 26 = 71 cents.
explanations.D: Almost! I think you forgot to carry the 10. The pencil and eraser cost 45 and 26 cents. 5 + 6 = 11, so we have an extra 10 to add up with the 40 and 20...
